Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Labor History Records
Labor History
TAM.257
29.75 Linear Feet in 31 boxes
1960-2010 Labor History is an academic journal publishing articles on the history of the labor movement in the United States and other countries. Between 1960 and 2003 the journal was published by the Tamiment Institute, later the Tamiment Library at New York University. The Labor History Records document the publication of the journal between 1960 and 2010 and consist of correspondence between editors and authors, and minutes of board meetings. Materials are in English.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.281.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Labor History Records; TAM 257; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Conditions Governing Use
Repository has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which are undated, are expected to enter the public domain in 120 years.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical Note
Labor History is an academic journal publishing articles on the history of the labor movement in the United States and other countries. Between 1960 and 2003 the journal was published by the Tamiment Institute, later the Tamiment Library at New York University. Daniel J. Leab was editor from 1974 into the late 1990s.
Processing Information
Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2019 are unknown. In 2019 materials in box 31 were placed in acid-free folders and description was created for the collection in compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description.
Scope and Contents
The Labor History Records document the publication of the journal between 1960 and 2010 and consist of correspondence between editors and authors, and minutes of board meetings. The bulk of the correspondence is that of Daniel J. Leab as editor and includes correspondence with authors and other members of the editorial board. Also included is the correspondence of Sidney Fine who served as a member of the editorial board in the 1980s.
Labor movement -- United States -- Periodicals. Correspondence. Minutes (administrative records) Leab, Daniel J. Fine, Sidney, 1920-2009
Editorial correspondence and board meeting minutes1963-2010311-5
